report_title: Industry Research: Natural Food Coloring Manufacturing
executive_summary: The Natural Food Coloring Manufacturing industry produces food additives made from plant or animal sources rather than chemical mixtures. Over the five years to 2022, operators in this industry have benefited from rising health consciousness and increased disposable incomes. As consumers increasingly turn away from products that include artificial coloring agents, demand for industry products rises. IBISWorld estimates that industry revenue will increase an annualized 5.3% to reach $361.5 million, including a 2.5% increase in 2022 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumer preferences have been shifting toward organic and more natural products. Over the five years to 2022, the healthy eating index has remained stable as Americans maintain their diets. Additionally, consumer spending increased at an annualized rate of 2.2% during the same period. This shows that Americans are maintaining healthy lifestyles and, with increased disposable incomes, they are able to trade up to premium products containing natural ingredients.

As more food producers endure pressure to abandon artificial food coloring, there has been an increasing demand for natural food coloring products that can produce the same color as their artificial counterparts. Consequently, the ability to develop new coloring products has been critical to the industry's success.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Health trends and technology drive growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, consumers will continue to demand that the processed foods they consume be free of potentially unhealthy artificial food additives. Better online platforms and more highly connected consumer bases will create stronger conditions for future campaigns against artificial coloring, increasing demand for natural alternatives.

More large food manufacturers are expected to make the switch to natural food coloring, increasing demand for industry products. This process is expected to lead to increased product development in the industry, creating more opportunities for industry operators to increase sales.

industry_definition: This industry develops and produces substances, liquids or powders that are added to a food or drink to change its color. The industry's products primarily use ingredients that are not made synthetically by humans. These color additives are exempt from the Food and Drug Administration's certification.

mixed_impact_factors: Medium - Increasing Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: Consumer preferences have been shifting toward organic and more natural products
Foreign demand for organic goods boost demand from downstream industries
As profit margins expand, the number of companies in the industry has increased
Better online platforms will create stronger conditions for future campaigns

market_segmentation.segment_description: A large portion of industry products are sold to downstream producers abroad. Exports are expected to account for 53.2% of industry revenue in 2022. The high level of exports is attributed to growing demand from foreign consumers who are increasingly becoming more health conscious.

All other food categories account for the remaining 12.9% of industry revenue in 2022. This segment includes natural pigments used to color fresh meats and seafood, processed and deli meats, condiments, spices, margarine and butter. In addition, some smaller industry operators produce natural food coloring products for sale to consumers via grocery stores, specialty food stores and other retail channels.

Beverage manufacturers are estimated to accounted for 10.1% of the market in 2022. This segment includes manufacturers of nonalcoholic beverages, such as soda, fruit and vegetable juices and sports drinks, as well as alcoholic beverages, such as whiskey. The most common natural pigment used in beverages is caramel color, which is responsible for giving dark sodas like Coca Cola or Pepsi their characteristic hue.

Processed food manufacturers are another major market for natural color additives, accounting for an estimated 8.7% of industry revenue in 2022. Rising consumer demand for clean-label processed foods has been the key driver of demand for this segment over the past five years.

Demand from candy and baked goods manufacturers is expected to account for 8.3% of industry revenue in 2022. Most candy manufacturers had historically used artificial additives to add flavor or color to their products. However, these trends have changed over the past five years in line with rising health consciousness and clean label trends that have affected most other food markets.

The dairy products segment is expected to account for 6.8% of industry revenue in 2022. Natural colors are most commonly added to cheese and yogurt varieties, with demand from milk (e.g. chocolate or strawberry flavored milk varieties) manufacturers accounting for an insignificant share of segment revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Anthocyanins are a class of flavonoid antioxidants naturally found in almost all plants, but most heavily concentrated in berries, dark and leafy vegetables and some grains. These chemicals are responsible for giving foods like blueberries and eggplants their characteristic blue, purple or deep red color.

Carotenoids are a class of over 600 different chemicals that have similar chemical structures, but widely different physical properties and applications. Carotenoids are responsible for the characteristic red, yellow or orange color of almost all fruits and vegetables, including carrots, peppers and sweet potatoes.

Betalains, which account for an estimated 13.0% of industry revenue in 2022, are a versatile class of natural pigments most commonly extracted from beets. Betalains consist of a mixture of two chemical groups that have distinct color profiles: betacyanins give off a deep magenta color, while betaxanthins have a yellow hue.

Carmine, also known as cochineal extract, is a deep-red pigment extracted from the shell of cochineals, which are a kind of insect that lives in arid environments. Carmine is one of the most versatile natural pigments in the industry and has excellent resistance to temperature and acidity changes.

tier_1_suppliers: Fruit & Nut Farming in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Industrial Supplies Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Frozen Food Production in the US
tier_2_buyers: Snack Food Production in the US
Cookie, Cracker & Pasta Production in the US
Ice Cream Production in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Economic factors, such as rising consumer spending and per capita disposable income, have a positive effect on demand for industry products. As disposable income rises and consumers have more money to spend on food, they are likely to increase spending on premium, clean-label or otherwise all-natural food varieties, which subsequently boosts demand for industry-relevant natural food additives.

Demand for natural food coloring products is primarily driven by noneconomic factors, such as shifts in consumer preferences toward natural or otherwise clean-label foods (rising health-consciousness) and favorable trends in food regulation. In particular, consumers are increasingly demanding food, beverage and snack products that are made with naturally derived or nature-identical flavors and colors.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Switzerland is the largest destination for industry products of exports in 2022. Key export destinations include Canada and Mexico. Due to their proximity and participation in the North American Free Trade Agreement, Canada and Mexico represent about a quarter of export revenue in 2022.

The Netherlands is a key source of imports because it is home to Chr. Hansen, one of the largest global natural food coloring companies. Conversely, India is a key exporter of standardized natural pigments, such as curcumin, betalains and fruit concentrates.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region accounts for 20.6% of industry establishments, led by Illinois (with large urban centers such as Chicago) with 7.7% of establishments. The Great Lakes region is home to several major players' manufacturing facilities and is where Archer Daniels Midland Company, the largest industry operator, is headquartered.

The West is home to the largest number of industry establishments, accounting for 20.1% of establishments. California houses more manufacturing facilities than any other state, comprising 13.2% of all industry establishments. San Francisco, Los Angeles and Seattle are ideal locations for food coloring manufacturers because such cities provide a large and affluent consumer base, well-established infrastructure and easy access to big population centers.
The Southeast accounts for 17.1% of establishments. The Southeast is primarily dominated by major player D.D. Williamson.

The Mid-Atlantic region is home to several smaller industry operators, such as Naturex Inc., Food Ingredients Solutions LLC and Grow Company Inc. Thus, the Mid-Atlantic region accounts for an estimated 16.1%.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is the primary regulatory body overseeing the natural food coloring manufacturing industry. Most natural color additives are exempt from the FDA's certification process for artificial food colors, which requires toxicological studies and batch certification of chemicals.

Furthermore, a wide range of food products have earned the 'generally recognized as safe' (GRAS) designation; operators that use GRAS ingredients are not required to notify the FDA of new product introductions, though they are still expected to follow current good manufacturing practices and other relevant manufacturing and quality control standards.

However, some natural color additives, such as carmine extract, may cause a severe allergic reaction in a small percentage of the population. Therefore, Food and beverage manufacturers that use these additives in their products are required to list these ingredients on the label.

As with all other food-related manufacturing industries, operators are subject to broad operating guidelines from other regulatory bodies, including the Environmental Protection Agency, Department of Labor and Department of Agriculture.
Some states may enact additional regulations on natural food coloring manufacturers that operate or market their products within state lines.

Additionally, during 2020, there were regulations set due to COVID-19 (coronavirus). These regulations included stay at home measures and mandatory business closures. These regulations negatively impacteded industry operators.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry requires a high level of initial capital investment, which may prevent smaller operators from entering the market.
Rising competition and the well-entrenched position of the industry's largest players make it difficult for new entrants to expand their business successfully.
The industry is characterized by a high level of new product innovation, which requires significant expenditures in research and development, testing and other initial investments.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete primarily on the basis of product quality, product safety and the ability to quickly develop and bring to the market highly customized color profiles that meet the needs of customers.
For standardized products like beta carotene and oil-soluble annatto, companies primarily compete on the basis of price and product purity.
Operators primarily endure external competition from artificial color manufacturers, which generally have lower operating costs and can sell their products at much lower prices.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest operators generate more than 70.9% of industry revenue.
Major players like Archer Daniels Midland continued to outperform the industry through continual product innovation and building strong relationships with key downstream markets.
Industry consolidation is being driven by increased merger and acquisition activity, such as Archer Daniels Midland's acquisition of Wild Flavors and Sensient's acquisition of GlobeNatural.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases constitute the largest share of industry expenses. Operators purchase natural food inputs such as carrots, tomatoes, blueberries, spirulina and other food products to extract their coloring.

Research and development is the largest among other costs. Developing new food coloring products can represent an increased market for operators as food processors look to transition from artificial coloring to natural, certification-exempt food coloring products, motivated by consumer concern about artificial additives.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Food processing equipment as well as scientific research equipment is required in the process of extracting natural color from foods. Office equipment including computers, printers and other electronics are also included as capital costs. These expenses are not that considerable, however, because this equipment is not that sophisticated or energy.

Overall, labor remains a larger expense for the industry. Therefore, using wages as a proxy for labor and depreciation as a proxy for capital, IBISWorld estimates that for every $1.00 spent on labor in the industry, $0.06 will be spent on capital in 2022.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Constant demand but volatility from downstream industries
volatility_points.volatility_description: Food coloring products are regular inputs in a variety of beverages and processed foods. Therefore, industry products are in constant demand. However, when downstream industries experience revenue volatility, they may choose to purchase more or less industry goods.
Over the five years to 2022, industry revenue has increased consistently, rising as much as 12.0% in 2018 and a low of 1.2% in 2019.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Natural Food Coloring Manufacturing industry has not been disrupted by technological developments. The industry has a high level of technological integration and automated machinery.
Advancements in the equipment used by the industry and the increase in automation help industry operators cut costs and labor.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Research on new formulas and ingredients
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Furthermore, research and development efforts have revolved around creating new formulas with healthier options and being as transparent as possible with the ingredients used.

Using the latest cold extraction and purification technologies enables operators to create higher-concentration pigments in both water and oil-soluble form. These highly concentrated pigments are much more vibrant and chemically stable than natural dyes extracted via traditional methods.

Companies are also developing stabilization systems, which mix the natural pigment with a combination of other naturally derived chemicals that helps the color remain uniform regardless of the acidity or temperature of the food to which it is added.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Imports have been rising gradually over the last five years, albeit slowly, thus their impact on overall industry revenue is somewhat negligible.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Many operators in the Natural Food Coloring Manufacturing industry also sell artificial food coloring, which allows them to expand their pool of potential clients who are interested in various food coloring products.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Natural food coloring businesses are continuously investing a significant portion of sales into research and development in order to develop new methods of extracting color or to enhance the pigmentation of colors.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in areas with well-established infrastructure?
FAQs.answer: Many large industry operators are frequently looking acquiring competitors in order to gain more market share. In addition, companies develop their own proprietary techniques which makes acquisitions appealing to companies looking to gain a competitive advantage.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to safeguard your company's proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Like many companies in the food business, natural food coloring producers often patent new technology in order to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation is continuing to play a significant role in natural food coloring manufacturing, however this trend has not helped reduce wages as companies now need high-skilled and expensive labor to operate the technology.

FAQs.question: How have international tariffs impacted your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: Colors that are not derived from vegetables or animals incur tariffs ranging from 3.1% to 6.5%.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Given the size of the industry and that there are very few natural food coloring producers, there are not many industry associations that help support the industry.

FAQs.question: Do you have any big projects on the horizon that will require capital financing?
FAQs.answer: Large natural food coloring producers are consistently working on multiple big projects, as they invest in research and development that is capital insensitive and costly.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Like many industries, larger operators typically yield higher profit margins than smaller operators as they benefit from economies of scale, which helps reduce costs and increase profitability.

FAQs.question: How do you stay informed about the latest technologies and software applications?
FAQs.answer: Industry performance moving forward will primarily be driven by new product introductions and continued innovation.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure your products are of the highest quality?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators that have access to the best natural sources will be able to create higher quality and more vibrant pigments, while minimizing extraction and purification costs.

FAQs.question: What markets do you target?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators that serve a wide range of food and beverage markets will be better safeguarded against cyclical forces than operators that choose to focus on one particular segment.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the healthy eating index?
FAQs.answer: Demand for natural food coloring is often generated when producers are looking for substitutes to artificial food coloring.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the agricultural price index?
FAQs.answer: The agricultural price index represents the price received by farmers for all agricultural products, including livestock and crops.

FAQs.question: How are you affected by an increase in disposable income?
FAQs.answer: As the economy continues to prosper, household disposable income is expected to rise.
